senses.sense_definition: A person who looks for, observes, or identifies specific people or things as a hobby or profession.

examples.text: The train <w>spotter</w> waited on the platform for hours to see the rare locomotive.
She works as a talent <w>spotter</w> for a major modeling agency.

senses.sense_definition: A person who assists a weightlifter or gymnast to ensure safety and help them complete a movement if necessary.

examples.text: You should always have a <w>spotter</w> when lifting heavy weights on the bench press.
The <w>spotter</w> grabbed the bar quickly when the athlete's muscles failed.

senses.sense_definition: A worker who directs the operator of a vehicle or crane from a position with better visibility to ensure safe movement.

examples.text: The truck driver relied on the <w>spotter</w> to guide him into the narrow loading bay.
Without a <w>spotter</w>, it is dangerous to operate the crane in such a crowded area.

senses.sense_definition: A member of a sniper team who locates targets and observes environmental conditions for the shooter.

examples.text: The <w>spotter</w> calculated the wind speed and distance before the shot was taken.
In a sniper team, the <w>spotter</w> is just as important as the person pulling the trigger.

senses.sense_definition: A team member who communicates with a racing driver to provide information about track conditions and nearby cars.

examples.text: The <w>spotter</w> warned the driver that a crash had occurred in the turn ahead.
Good communication between the driver and the <w>spotter</w> is essential for avoiding accidents.

senses.sense_definition: An assistant who helps a sports commentator identify players or events during a live broadcast.

examples.text: The commentator's <w>spotter</w> pointed to the name on the roster as the player entered the field.
A <w>spotter</w> helps ensure the announcer calls out the correct names during the fast-paced game.

senses.sense_definition: A dolphin of the genus Stenella, typically characterized by spots on its body.

examples.text: We were lucky to see a <w>spotter</w> leaping from the water during our boat trip.
The marine biologist identified the animal as a <w>spotter</w> due to its distinctive markings.
